entries.content: Starting logo animation work session with Moti. We've built: ultra-modular animation system, CSS wave animations (5 patterns), radial color gradient waves, and welcome screen animations. Some Anime.js CDN issues encountered previously. Ready to continue animation development.

Found the bug! Both animations are registered and both call .start() automatically. They're both applying CSS classes to the same cube elements:
- CSSWaveController adds 'wave-animating' class
- ColorGradientWaveController adds 'color-wave-animating' class

Both animations are running simultaneously and competing for the same elements. The CSS animations are likely conflicting on the 'fill' attribute.

Bug identified: On load wave works, colors don't. When wave is disabled, colors start working. Hypothesis: animations are removing classes instead of appending them - likely removing ALL classes instead of just their own.

Animation System Architecture Analysis - Semantix Logo

PROBLEM: Both CSSWaveController and ColorGradientWaveController set the `animation` CSS property independently. When both run, only one executes because setting a new animation property overwrites the previous one.

KEY FINDING: The CSS spec allows multiple animations via comma-separated values in the `animation` property, but current implementation sets them independently.

Current Animation Property Patterns:
- CSSWaveController: Sets on .logo-cube.wave-animating via CSS rule
  animation: wave-pulse var(--wave-duration) var(--wave-easing) var(--wave-delay) infinite
  
- ColorGradientWaveController: Sets on .color-wave-animating via CSS rule
  animation: colorWave var(--color-wave-duration) var(--color-wave-easing) var(--color-wave-delay) infinite

Both use classes added to elements, not inline styles. CSS rules stack, but animation property overwrites.

SOLUTION APPROACH: Create MultiAnimationManager to track and rebuild animation property using comma-separated values.

Architecture analysis complete. The problem is CSS animation property collision - both controllers set the animation property via CSS classes, causing only one to work. Solution: Create MultiAnimationManager that combines multiple animations into comma-separated inline animation property. Controllers will register animation configs instead of adding CSS classes.

Implementation complete! Created MultiAnimationManager that tracks active animations per element and rebuilds the inline animation property as comma-separated list. Updated both controllers (CSSWaveController, ColorGradientWaveController) to register animations with manager instead of using CSS classes. Updated SemantixLogoOrchestrator to create manager and inject into controllers. Both animations should now work simultaneously.

SUCCESS! Bug fixed and confirmed working. Both wave and color gradient animations now run simultaneously. User tested at http://127.0.0.1:5501/ and confirmed both animations work together. The MultiAnimationManager successfully combines multiple CSS animations using comma-separated animation property.
